meanings.definition: A device used for carrying a sick or injured person.
meanings.sent1: The stretcher helped the paramedics transport the injured man.
meanings.sent2: The hospital always keeps stretchers ready for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The stretcher looked like a narrow bed on wheels.
meanings.sent4: Her arms felt like stretchers carrying the weight of the world.
meanings.sent5: The bright red stretcher stood out in the white hospital hallway.

meanings.definition: A piece of canvas or other material stretched on a frame and used for carrying the sick or wounded.
meanings.sent1: The stretcher made of canvas was lightweight and easy to carry.
meanings.sent2: The army medics used stretchers to transport the injured soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The stretcher looked like a makeshift hammock in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a stretcher, carrying comfort to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The old stretcher had patches where the fabric had been mended.

meanings.definition: A wooden framework on which canvas is stretched and fixed for oil painting.
meanings.sent1: The artist placed the canvas on the stretcher to start painting.
meanings.sent2: The art class students learned how to assemble a stretcher for their canvases.
meanings.sent3: The stretcher in the studio creaked as the painter worked on a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a stretcher, holding the creative ideas firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The stretcher in the art gallery displayed a stunning landscape painting.
